Ireland, introduced and invasive, Britain, introduced and invasive

Common Rhododendron is a dense shrub with a suckering nature. It has glossy leaves and bright purple to red flowers for which it was originally introduced as an ornamental. It is not very invasive in both Ireland and Britain.
